Hide Infrequently Used NTDS Performance Counters

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTopResponseTime

StringTable.String: Top directory search taking {result} milliseconds which is above the rule threshold value.

String.loc.comment: Details string for warning message: WarnAdTopResponseTime

StringTable.String: Maximum acceptable directory search response time (in milliseconds). This rule will issue a warning if the search response time exceeds this value. The default value is > 10000 (10 seconds).

String.loc.comment: Resolution string for warning message: WarnAdTopResponseTime

StringTable.String: Examine the query details.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdAncestorsIndex

StringTable.String: Inappropriate ancestry index searches are occurring.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdPdntIndex

StringTable.String: Inappropriate Parent Distinguished Name Tag index searches are occurring

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdDntIndex

StringTable.String: Distinguised Name Tag index searches are occurring. Because this method searches the entire directory tree, it should occur only rarely. Consider adding indexes if this query is done frequently.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdDsNameCacheLow

StringTable.String: The directory search name cache hit rate is low compared to the number of LDAP searches that are occurring.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdReferrals

StringTable.String: A client application is using search referrals, indicating that its LDAP_OPT_REFERRALS option is on. LDAP client applications should explicitly disable search referrals unless their code is willing to use the referral data.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTopObjectVisited

StringTable.String: Top directory search visited {result} objects and consumed {cpu} percent CPU. The search may need a new index or an adjusted scope.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTooManyObjectReturned

StringTable.String: Top Directory Search returning {result} objects. Consider the use of paged searches or setting the maximum objects read per search to reduce the number of objects read.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTopObjectReturned

StringTable.String: Top client taking {result} percent CPU.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTopCPUSearch

StringTable.String: Single search taking {result} percent CPU.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdTgsFailures

StringTable.String: Kerberos protocol is failing more often than succeeding.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdEncryptionOverhead

StringTable.String: Kerberos protocol modes are mixed.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdLdapFailures

StringTable.String: More LDAP failures than successes are occurring.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdLdapExitIdFailure

StringTable.String: LDAP errors are consuming {result} percent CPU.

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdDitFile

StringTable.String: On directory servers, Ntds.dit and Edb.log should be the most active files. In this case, {file} has the highest I/O rate ({result} operations/sec).

String.loc.comment: Symptom string for warning message: WarnAdWhereslsass

StringTable.String: Process {result} has the highest CPU percent ({image}%). For this server role, the top process should be Lsass.exe (for Active Directory Domain Services) or Dsamain.exe (for Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services).
